intro: Maniltoa brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed maniltoa, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, woolly leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in lowland forest areas and is adapted to humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
